sentence.Network_cn: 我想我得快速浏览一下最近发生的事情。

phrase.cizu_name: give someone the flick (或 get the flick)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly Austral.)reject (or be rejected) in a casual or offhand way
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主澳)随便唐突地拒绝（或被拒）

jx.jx_en_mean: look or search quickly through (a volume or a collection of papers)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 浏览，飞快翻阅（书，文件集）

lj.lj_ly: flick through the phone book and pick a company.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: symbolic, fl- frequently beginning words denoting sudden movement

entry.def: If something flicks in a particular direction, or if someone flicks it, it moves with a short, sudden movement.

example.ex: His tongue flicked across his lips...
example.tran: 他的舌头迅速舔了一下嘴唇。

example.ex: The man's gun flicked up from beside his thigh...
example.tran: 那个男人迅速从大腿一侧抽出枪来。

entry.def: If you flick something away, or off something else, you remove it with a quick movement of your hand or finger.

example.ex: Shirley flicked a speck of fluff from the sleeve of her black suit...
example.tran: 雪莉弹掉了黑色套装袖子上的一点小绒毛。

example.ex: Alan stretched out his hand and flicked the letter away.

entry.def: If you flick something such as a whip or a towel, or flick something with it, you hold one end of it and move your hand quickly up and then forward, so that the other end moves.

example.ex: He helped her up before flicking the reins...
example.tran: 他帮她上马，之后挥动了缰绳。

example.ex: She sighed and flicked a dishcloth at the counter...
example.tran: 她叹了一口气，然后用洗碗布轻掸着柜台。

entry.def: If you flick a switch, or flick an electrical appliance on or off, you press the switch sharply so that it moves into a different position and works the equipment.

example.ex: He flicked a light-switch on the wall beside the door...
example.tran: 他啪的一声打开了门边墙上的电灯开关。

example.ex: Sam was flicking a flashlight on and off...
example.tran: 萨姆啪啪不停地把手电筒开了又关。

entry.tran: 快速翻阅;浏览;不停地转换(电视频道)
entry.def: If you flick through a book or magazine, you turn its pages quickly, for example to get a general idea of its contents or to look for a particular item. If you flick through television channels, you continually change channels very quickly, for example using a remote control.

example.ex: She was flicking through some magazines on a table...
example.tran: 她正翻看着桌上的几本杂志。

example.ex: I'll just flick through the pages until I find the right section...
example.tran: 我会快速地翻页，直到找到要找的那一部分。

means.word_mean: 1. a light sharp contact (usually with something flexible);

sentences.sentence: "he gave it a flick with his finger"
"he felt the flick of a whip"

means.word_mean: 2. a form of entertainment that enacts a story by a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement;

sentences.sentence: "they went to a movie every Saturday night"

means.word_mean: 2. look through a book or other written material;
3. cause to move with a flick;
4. throw or toss with a quick motion;

sentences.sentence: "flick a piece of paper across the table"

means.word_mean: 7. cause to make a snapping sound;
8. touch or hit with a light, quick blow;
9. remove with a flick (of the hand, for example)

auth_sentence.content: The safety-catch...is...released with an easy flick of the thumb.
auth_sentence.res_content: The safety-catch...is...released with an easy flick of the thumb.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The safety-catch...is...released with an easy flick of the thumb.

auth_sentence.res_content: Two girls flick their cigarette butts onto the ground.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Two girls flick their cigarette butts onto the ground.

auth_sentence.content: They can't even flick their pants in the air.
auth_sentence.res_content: They can't even flick their pants in the air.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They can't even flick their pants in the air.

means.word_mean: （尤指用手指或手快速地）轻击，轻拍，轻拂，轻弹

sentences.en: He flicked the dust from his suit.

means.word_mean: （用鞭子等的）轻打；（身体部份的）小快动作

sentences.en: He gave a flick of the whip.

jushi.english: He flicked the dust from his suit.
He gave a flick of the whip.
